programme.desc: The continuing saga of a young Vito Corleone growing up in Sicily and in New York during the 1910s and then following Michael Corleone in the 1950s as he tries to expand the family business.

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor, (1975, Thriller)
programme.desc: A mild-mannered CIA researcher, paid to read books, returns from lunch to find all of his co-workers assassinated. "Condor" must find out who did this and get in from the cold before the hitmen get him.

programme.title: The Godfather, (1972, Crime)
programme.desc: A chilling portrait of the Corleone family's rise and near fall from power in America along with balancing the story of the Sicilian clan's ugly crime business in which they are engaged.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II, (1974, Crime)
programme.desc: The continuing saga of a young Vito Corleone growing up in Sicily and in New York during the 1910s and then following Michael Corleone in the 1950s as he tries to expand the family business.

programme.title: Little Big Man, (1970, Western)
programme.desc: From director Arthur Penn (BONNIE AND CLYDE), Dustin Hoffman, Chief Dan George, Faye Dunaway, Martin Balsam, Jeff Corey and Richard Mulligan star in a genre-defying tale of an alleged 121-year-old white survivor of Custer's Last Stand.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba is helpless against Pegasus's Toon World deck and mind-reading abilities. As the duel ends, Pegasus imprisons Kaiba's soul into a card, just like Grandpa and Mokuba!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi vows to overthrow Pegasus for the sake of his Grandpa. Tristan leads an exploration party to uncover Pegasus's secrets. While Joey sleeps, Bandit Keith steals from him the card that permits his entry in the final battle!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Under Pegasus's glare, Yugi is distracted from his duel with Mai. After making foolish errors and allowing Mai to gain a huge advantage with her Harpie's Pet Dragon, will Yugi gather his focus or succumb to the pressure?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Mai has rebounded from her previous loss to Joey to become a better duelist. Has Yugi learned from his loss to Kaiba, or is the emotional defeat still weighing on his heart? The answer is in the cards!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey searches for the card that permits him to enter the final battle, not realizing Bandit Keith has stolen it. As he struggles to accept the fact that Serenity will be blind forever, he receives help from a new friend!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Bandit Keith's Machine deck forces Joey to take the defensive, Joey mimics Keith's battle strategy to metalize his Red-Eyes Black Dragon! Is victory assured, or does the cheater Bandit Keith literally have one last card up his sleeve?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey challenges Yugi for the right to face Pegasus. In a battle between friends, a fierce match ensues between the two people who know each other's strategies and cards.
programme.sub-title: Best of Friends Best of Duelists, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi is shocked as Joey uses the Time Wizard card on him. It's the very same card Yugi gave Joey as a sign of friendship!
programme.sub-title: Best of Friends Best of Duelists, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi prepares for the ultimate battle against Pegasus with the souls of Grandpa, Kaiba, and Mokuba on the line.
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus punishes Yugi using the same Toon Deck and mind-reading abilities he used on Kaiba. As Pegasus turns Yugi's monsters against him, Yugi loses the will to battle. Will Pegasus capture Yugi's soul into a card, just like Kaiba?
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi has found a counter to Pegasus's mind-reading ability: Yugi switches back and forth between his two souls! Yugi is able to destroy Pegasus's Toon World, but the duel has just only begun. The next level of the deadly Shadow Game is about to start!
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 3

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi crumples under the power of the Shadow Game. His friends yell desperate encouragement, but their voices cannot penetrate the sphere of darkness. Yugi's chance at victory is slipping away, as is his life!
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 4

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus summons Relinquished, a fearsome monster that can consume Yugi's Duel Monsters! Yugi counters with… Kuriboh?
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 5

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi meets a mysterious Egyptian named Shadi who enters Yugi's mind with the Millennium Key. What are these Millennium Items, and do they hold the answer to the mystery behind the Shadow Games?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends return from the Duelist Kingdom only to meet a young girl named Rebecca who demands that Grandpa return Blue-Eyes White Dragon to her.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Rebecca mistakenly believes that Grandpa stole the Blue-Eyes White Dragon from her grandfather. Yugi must defend the Blue-Eyes White Dragon to teach her that it's not the power of the cards, but the heart that's in them that counts.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The two-faced Board of Directors of Kaiba Corporation trap Kaiba inside a virtual reality game. Mokuba recruits Yugi and Joey to free Kaiba from this ultimate game where losing equals death!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The quest for Kaiba continues with a little help from… Mai? But can YUGI and friends adapt to a virtual world where the rules and strategies keep changing every step of the way?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends rescue Kaiba, but they are still stuck in the game! The only exit is past a Five-Headed Dragon, but in the difficult duel, Joey, Mokuba, and Mailose all their life points!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Duke Devlin defeats Joey and humiliates him in public, forcing Yugi to challenge Duke to a duel. However, this will not be a Duel Monsters duel, but a new game named Dungeon Dice Monsters!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: In exchange for Joey's freedom, Yugi agrees to give up Duel Monsters forever if he loses. Unfamiliar with the rules, Yugi gets off to a rough start.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi uses his innate gaming skills to turn the tables on Duke, but Duke has one more rule to mention: All creatures take up territory on the grid-like board. With no room to summon any new monsters, Yugi's position is helpless!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Duke's all-powerful Orogoth The Relentless dices Yugi's entire cadre of monsters into shreds, Yugi only has one turn left before he loses all his heart points!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: An arcane fortune teller steals the Millennium Puzzle and Yugi must defeat him in a duel to win it back.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The mysterious menace controlling Bandit Keith shatters the Millennium Puzzle into pieces before setting the dueling arena ablaze. Can Yugi put the Millennium Puzzle back together and save the spirit before the entire room is engulfed in flames?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The origin of Duel Monsters is revealed. Using the magic of the Millennium Necklace, Egyptian historian Ishizu Ishtar shows Kaiba how Duel Monsters was played millenniums ago.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The spirit of the Millennium Puzzle realizes that his memories of ancient Egypt have faded, but Tea helps him uncover the mysteries of his past.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi learns that he was a powerful Pharaoh who saved the world five thousand years ago, and he must now save the world again.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey is cornered by a group of sinister Rare Hunters who force Joey into a duel. If he loses, the Rare Hunters get his precious Red-Eyes Black Dragon!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's time to master new rules and monsters; let the Battle City Tournament commence! In the first duel of the tournament, Yugi challenges the Rare Hunter to win back Joey's Red-Eyes Black Dragon.
programme.sub-title: Yugi Vs. Rare Hunter Part 1 - Battle City Begins

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi figures out the Rare Hunter's strategy to summon the almighty Exodia, but it's too late to stop him. The Rare Hunter already has four pieces of Exodia in his hand, and the fifth and final piece is on top of his deck.
programme.sub-title: Yugi Vs. Rare Hunter Part 2 - Up Against Exodia

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The psychic duelist Espa Roba defeats Rex Raptor as easy as a chumpasaurus, and Joey's next on his hit list. What chance does Joey have when Espa Roba has the telepathic ability to read all the cards in Joey's hand?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey discovers that Espa Roba's extrasensory perception was a hoax, that he's not yet free from Espa's mental manipulations.

programme.title: Luffy and Nami refuse to believe that the Going Merry’s seaworthy days are finished, but for now, bigger problems loom on the horizon! Their money is missing again, along with Usopp!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Pirate abduction incident! A pirate ship that can only await her end!

programme.title: Usopp bravely tries to recover the stolen money, but the Franky Family has him badly outnumbered. Zoro, Sanji, and Chopper set out on a rescue mission, but they’ll need Luffy to even the odds!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Rescuing our friend! Raid on the franky house!

programme.title: Usopp regains consciousness after his vicious beating, but he’s not at all happy to hear Luffy’s plans for the Going Merry. Temper flares and challenges are issued as the Straw Hats face their most uncertain hour.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Big fight under the moon! The pirate flag flutters with sorrow!

programme.title: Luffy and Usopp battle to a brutal standstill in a heartbreaking duel between men who once called each other family. Can the Straw Hats find the strength to carry on without their sniper?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Luffy vs. Usopp! Collision of two men's pride!

programme.title: The Straw Hat split is overshadowed by an assassination attempt on the mayor of Water Seven! Luffy is eager to investigate, but the leader of the Franky Family is about to reappear!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Severe shock hits the city of water! Iceberg targeted!

programme.title: Luffy’s grudge match with Franky gets serious when his opponent turns out to be a cyborg! Iceberg awakes from his slumber only to hurl heinous accusations at the Straw Hats!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Luffy is branded an assassin and attacked by Iceberg’s strongest men! Meanwhile, Sanji and Chopper attempt to warn Usopp about an impending natural disaster!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The straw hat pirates are the culprits? The protectors of the city of water!

programme.title: The citizens of Water Seven search for the Straw Hats and a devastating storm threatens to sink the city. Chopper and Sanji pick up Robin’s trail, but they aren’t prepared for what they’ll find.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Eternal farewell? Nico robin: the woman who draws darkness!

programme.title: Usopp prepares to ride out the storm aboard the Going Merry, Franky hatches a plan to force Luffy into a rematch, and the Straw Hats set out to uncover Robin’s dark secret.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Capture robin! The determination of the straw hats!

programme.title: Robin and her CP9 brethren seek to settle unfinished business with Iceberg. The Straw Hats have a plan to clear their names, but the assassins are one step ahead of them.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Cannon fire is the signal! Cp9 goes into action!

programme.title: Luffy makes his long-awaited entrance, Iceberg has a shocking surprise in store for Robin, and the true identities of the masked assassins of CP9 are finally revealed!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Cp9 takes off their masks! Their shocking true faces!

programme.title: CP9 listens to Iceberg’s blood to learn the location of the blueprints, Usopp has another run-in with Franky and the remaining Straw Hats – plus a new friend – race to the rescue!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Luffy and the gang come face to face with Robin and her CP9 comrades. The rubberman is prepared to fight for his friend, but he’s never faced foes like this!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Come back, Robin! Showdown with cp9!

programme.title: Luffy, Zoro, and Nami are sent hurtling toward their deaths by the villains of CP9! Meanwhile, Usopp forges an unlikely friendship with Franky while waiting out a storm.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The straw hat pirates annihilated? The menace of the leopard model!

programme.title: Franky tries to convince Usopp that there’s no hope for the Going Merry, but the sniper – inspired by a mysterious moment from the past – remains loyal to his beloved boat
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The man who is loved even by his ship! Usopp's tears!

programme.title: A look back at Franky’s past reveals the amazing origins of the sea train – and paints a vivid picture of his younger days, spent alongside Iceberg and the legendary shipwright Tom!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Franky's past! The day the sea train first ran!

programme.title: Franky’s backstory continues! The sea train is a success, and it looks like Tom’s life is spared! Unfortunately, a government spy is searching for a reason to investigate Tom, and Franky provides the ammunition!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Spandam's scheme! The day the sea train shook!

programme.title: Tom does the unthinkable in an attempt to protect his apprentices, but young Franky is unable to control his rage, leading to a showdown with a spy – and a train!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The end of the legendary man! The day the sea train cried!

programme.title: Chopper’s heroism may mean the difference between life and death for Iceberg and Paulie, Nami learns the agonizing truth about Robin, and Sanji prepares to make his move!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The truth behind her betrayal! Robin's sorrowful decision!

programme.title: Nami makes a frantic dash for the Sea Train station, Chopper searches desperately for Zoro and Luffy, and Sanji plays it cool while waiting for the right time to spring into action.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The steam whistle forces friends apart! The sea train starts to run

programme.title: Nami arrives at the train station a minute too late, Sanji makes his presence aboard the sea train known, and the search for Luffy and Zoro continues!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sanji barges in! Sea train battle in the storm!

programme.title: Chopper and Robin risk their own lives in a desperate attempt to save Luffy and Zoro from a monstrous wall of water! Meanwhile, Sanji moves ever closer to a reunion with Robin.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Nami's soul cries out! Straw hat luffy makes a comeback!

programme.title: Luffy and Nami ask to borrow a ship so they can chase down the sea train, but the weather is too severe to set sail. Lucky for them, Iceberg and his friends are full of surprises!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Another sea train? Rocketman charges forth!

programme.title: Luffy, Zoro, Chopper, and Nami rocket toward a rendezvous with the assassins of CP 9, but they’ll need to forge an alliance with some new friends to have any chance at survival!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Rescue our friends! A bond among foes sworn with fists!

programme.title: Zoro and Luffy go head-to-head with Mother Nature, and Sanji’s rescue mission is bolstered by Franky’s allegiance – and the arrival of the mysterious Sniper King!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Smash the wave! Luffy and zoro use the strongest combo!

programme.title: Sniper King, a mysterious warrior from the island of snipers, lends a hand as Franky and Sanji try to fight their way to Robin.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A mysterious man appears?! His name is sniper king!

programme.title: Sanji mixes it up with a deranged cook, Franky dukes it out with the newest member of CP9, and the Sniper King gets creative in his attempt to reach Robin!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Showdown between cooks! Sanji vs. Ramen kenpo!

programme.title: Franky and Sanji continue to battle the thugs of CP9. Meanwhile, Luffy and the rest of the gang find themselves headed for a collision that could spell doom for everyone!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Zoro faces a fellow master of the blade, Sanji looks to end his fight against a rampaging ramen master, and Franky finally lands a big blow against his CP9 foe!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Clash! Demon-slasher zoro vs. Ship-slasher t-bone!

programme.title: The Sniper King hatches a daring escape plan, but the assassins of CP9 are more powerful than our heroes ever imagined. Meanwhile, Luffy and the gang run into a very familiar frog!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Scramble over robin! A cunning plan by sniper king!

programme.title: As their train approaches Enies Lobby, Franky’s kind words cut through Robin’s cold exterior. Luffy’s train is thrown off course, but the group gains a powerful new ally!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The judicial island! Full view of enies lobby!

programme.title: The Straw Hats hatch a plan to rescue Robin, but as usual, Luffy can’t wait to find a fight. Will his impulsive attack derail their mission?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Landing operations start! Charge in, straw hats!

programme.title: Luffy manages to reach the main island, but the Franky Family’s assault is stopped short by a couple of angry giants!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Luffy cuts through! Big showdown on the judicial island!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: While trying to snag General Hatler's prize medallion, which contains a fifty-carat ruby, Lupin inadvertently reels in Hatler's biggest secret, his toupee! An enraged General Hatler orders Lupin and his gang to be killed.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Upon returning to Japan, Goemon finds his master on the brink of death. Furthermore, Jinkuro, a fellow disciple, had stolen half of the scroll containing the Secret Arts of the Iga Ninja. Will Goemon be able to avenge his master?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen are in a remote area pursing a mysterious treasure, when they save a woman being chased by hoodlums. The woman invites the two back to her sister's manor, which is full of beautiful women…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A mysterious woman who claims to be Fujiko's aunt, gives Lupin an ultimatum: Find Marshal Rommel's lost gold or die! First, Lupin must decipher the location of the gold, written in ancient hieroglyphs.
programme.sub-title: A Witch in the Fourth Dimension

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The great thief Nezumi-Kozou Jirokichi IV appears before Goemon and reveals that their ancestors competed in the first International Thieves Championship together, but were defeated by Lupin's grandfather, Arsène Lupin…
programme.sub-title: The Phantom Thief Rat Boy Appears

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The warden of an African prison is holding Fujiko captive. Lupin and his gang infiltrate the prison and attempt to break Fujiko out, but they become the target of the Iron Lizards, robotic devices developed to chase down fugitives!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Linda, a beautiful dancer, has stolen Jigen's heart and a vengeful Meyer has taken Fujiko hostage. Believing the women they love are in danger and unaware that Linda and Meyer are working together, Lupin and Jigen are set up to kill each other…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: According to legend, a stamp named the Cinderella Shadow is said to make its owner a princess. Lupin and his gang pull off the heist, but a girl name Alice who also wants the stamp tags along. Will the little girl get her royal wish?
programme.sub-title: Where did the Cinderella Stamp Go?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has sent a notice declaring he will steal all the cash from every bank in Paris. Detective Melon, the granddaughter of Inspector Garimard, is chosen to catch Lupin alongside Inspector Zenigata.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has many secret techniques up his sleeve, and one of them is his Levitation Technique. In order to get their hands on this technique, a crime syndicate plots a dirty trick, where a fake Lupin tortures a man known as X8 and frames the real Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Inspector Zenigata get kidnapped and the two are forcibly conscripted into the Foreign Legion in Morocco. Lupin and Inspector Zenigata make a run for it, but not before they're shackled together at the neck.
programme.sub-title: The Wind in Morocco is Hot

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Beautiful Swedish twins, Latica and Anita, are engaged in a battle to the death over the Viking treasure map concealed on their backs. In disguise, Lupin learns the map's secret, but the map possesses an additional secret.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A hit has been ordered on Lupin and Puma, a formidable hitman who specializes in long-range attacks, is on his trail! Lupin takes his chances with a close range, one-on-one showdown against Puma, but the plan seemingly backfires and Lupin is shot…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Orion's Crown has been stolen and is up for grabs at a black-market auction. Lupin has his eyes on both the crown and the auction money, but first he must outsmart the other parties vying for the crown, including Fujiko.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A two-thousand-year-old casket has been excavated. Inside the casket is Camilla, a beautiful woman in a near-death state, holding a golden statuette of the Virgin Mary. Lupin attempts to steal the golden statuette, but things don't go as planned…
programme.sub-title: Lupin Who Turned into a Vampire

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are attending a party in Africa, waiting for an opportunity to snatch a rare black pearl. However, their plan goes awry when a gang of gorillas crashes the party and steals the black pearl.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Massive riches have been hidden inside Tsukikage Castle. Lupin and his gang must decipher a code to find out the whereabouts of this great treasure. Wii Lupin be able to locate the treasure before his rivals do?
programme.sub-title: Uncover the Secret of Tsukikage Castle

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen head to Mongolia in search of Genghis Khan's treasures. Meanwhile, Goemon is visiting his ancestor's grave to pay his respects when he encounters Fujiko, who is in search of Yoshitsune Minamoto's buried treasure.
programme.sub-title: The Hidden Gold of Genghis Khan

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The ICPO chief promises to erase Fujiko's criminal record in exchange for her cooperation in arresting Lupin. Up against an ego-bruised Inspector Zenigata and a determined Fujiko, have Lupin's heisting days come to an end?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen sneak on board a ship smuggling diamonds. However, what they find on board are several thousand chickens! Lupin and his gang infiltrate the Hong Kong smuggling boss's lair where diamonds are being illicitly sold…
programme.sub-title: Diamonds Disappeared Under the Sky of Hong Kong

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang steal a suitcase containing Costa Rican diamonds, but the contents turns out to be Inspector Zenigata. The real diamonds are being shipped to Puerto Rico inside a missile and Lupin must find out the precise launch time to intercept it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Kaguya, a beautiful woman, separately asks Lupin, Jigen and Goemon to gather the tears of the Yeti, a mermaid's scale, and the liver of a dragon so she can make a secret potion.
programme.sub-title: Search for the Treasure of Princess Kaguya

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A wealthy shipping magnate and also a bachelor, Onabes' final voyage is nothing short of extravagant, with a ship full of beautiful women and fine art. Things go as planned when Lupin infiltrates the ship disguised as a woman…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is in Hong Kong for a vacation when he is asked to find a woman in return for helping him escape from Inspector Zenigata. Lupin discovers the pickpocket who stole his wallet is the daughter of the woman he is looking for…
programme.sub-title: Where are the Peking Man's Bones?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Sleeping Lion, a statue made of solid gold, is being transported to a museum by a specially armored, airtight car. Lupin steals the armored car together with the statue and nearly asphyxiated Inspector Zenigata inside.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin manages to steal crime boss Mulligan's precious jewels, only have them stolen from him by Fujiko! Mulligan, unaware that Fujiko has his jewels, hires a skilled gunman named Hangman to take them back from Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has been put on auction at the Wanted Club and Dr. Mad places the winning bid. Dr. Mad also purchases Fujiko and Jigen from the auctions. The three are abandoned on a deserted island with killer cyborgs.
programme.sub-title: Lupin is Available to the Highest Bidder

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has his eyes on the royal family's Imperial State Crown, but thanks to Scotland Yard's Inspector Dover, stealing it won't be easy.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin announces he's going to steal the betting takes at the Kentucky Derby, but the heist fails. However, it's all part of the plan. Lupin's main target is really the Metropolitan Bank's underground vault.
programme.sub-title: Lupin Laughs at the Alarm Bell

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: After several divorces and a couple of deceased husbands, Jacqueline has amassed a fortune and a collection of impressive jewels. In a twist of fate, Lupin and Jacqueline become close... Too close for Jigen and Goemon's comfort…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: An illicit auction selling smuggled treasures is taking place. Lupin targets the auction. In the process, Lupin discovers the auctioneer is Cornelia, the woman he once loved who died saving his life…
programme.sub-title: The Lupin I Loved, Part One

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is reunited with Cornelia, a woman who died by her father's hands to save Lupin's life. However, Cornelia's memories of Lupin have been erased. Her father is Dr. Zel, a Nazi who has succeeded in resurrecting corpses and controlling them.
programme.sub-title: The Lupin I Loved, Part Two

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko discovers that the Holy Scripture for Immortality is hidden within the jungles of Thailand. However, Emmanuelle Poirot, a cold-hearted beauty, is after them too.

programme.title: The Matrix, (1991, Action)
programme.desc: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence. Every second becomes a fight to stay alive - to escape The Matrix.

programme.title: The Matrix Reloaded, (2003, Action)
programme.desc: In the second chapter of the Matrix trilogy, Zion falls under siege to the Machine Army. Neo and Trinity choose to return to the Matrix with Morpheus. Now, Neo must follow the path he has chosen if he is to save humanity.

programme.title: The Matrix Revolutions, (2003, Action)
programme.desc: In this final chapter of the Matrix trilogy, Neo, Morpheus, and Trinity battle to defend Zion against the onslaught of the machines that have enslaved the human race. And Neo faces the consequences of the choice made in The Matrix Reloaded.

programme.title: The Fifth Element, (1997, Action)
programme.desc: Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world.

programme.title: Stealth, (2005, Action)
programme.desc: From the director of XXX and The Fast and The Furious comes an exhilarating epic blockbuster starring Josh Lucas, Jessica Biel and Academy Award® Winner Jamie Foxx (Best Actor, RAY, 2004). rated -PG-13

programme.title: Robocop, (1987, Action)
programme.desc: Detroit in the near future. A cop who dies in the line of duty is transformed into a crime-fighting cyborg by the corporation which now runs the police department. The only hitch: this "perfect" cop still seeks revenge on the creeps who mutilated him.

programme.title: The Matrix, (1991, Action)

programme.desc: The four rowdy sons of Katie Elder return home for her funeral and to avenge her death.

programme.title: Big Jake, (1971, Action)
programme.desc: An aging Texas cattle man who has outlived his time swings into action when outlaws kidnap his grandson and wound his son.

programme.title: The Shootist, (1976, Action)
programme.desc: Afflicted with a terminal illness, John Bernard Books, the last of the legendary gunfighters, quietly returns to Carson City for medical attention from his old friend Dr. Hostetler.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, (1962, Western)
programme.desc: Jimmy Stewart plays the bungling but charming big-city lawyer determined to rid the fair village of Shinbone of its number one nuisance and bad man: Liberty Valance.

programme.title: The Gambler, (1980, Action)
programme.desc: Kenny Rogers as The Gambler (1980) features the famed singer-songwriter in a tale of the Old West inspired by one of his most beloved songs.

programme.title: The Gambler II (Part 1), (1983, Action)
programme.desc: Brady Hawkes, Billy Montana, and Jeremiah Hawkes are on a train bound for a huge gambling event when the train is taken over by a gang of vicious killers in search of money. As ransom, the gang takes young Jeremiah hostage.

programme.desc: Brady Hawkes and Billy Montana join forces once again in this new adventure. This time around their goal is to help the Sioux fight the government and get the supplies they need.

programme.desc: Brady Hawkes and Billy Montana join forces once again in this new adventure. This time around their goal is to help the Sioux fight the government and get the supplies they need.

programme.desc: Seeing the happy couples around her, Minako starts questioning her life as a Sailor Guardian and the sacrifices she has to make.

programme.title: Sailor Moon

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: After experiencing a humiliating defeat by a Daimon, Makoto decides to retrain herself in the mountains.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The girls are taking a tour at one of the high schools they plan to apply to next year.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa is stunned at the sight of Usagi and the others enjoying a pie since she actually made the pie for Masanori, the boy she has a crush on.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Mamoru and the girls receive an invitation to a party hosted by Edwards, an Englishman who lives alone on the outskirts of the town.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Minako realizes that she is the only Sailor Guardian who has not been targeted by a Daimon.
programme.sub-title: The Shocking Moment: Everyone's Identities Revealed

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Michiru and Haruka sense that soon they will find the talismans.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Uranus and Neptune are revealed to be the ones possessing the talismans. The Sailor Guardians go after Eudial, who is on the run with their talismans.

programme.title: Sailor Moon

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi is very intrigued when she hears Chibi-Usa is going to a 'friend’s' house to play.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Minako and Mimete enter a movie audition where the winner gets to costar with the idol Jinta Araki. Both girls are eager to win the role.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The Three Guardians of the Outer Solar System sense something dangerous lurking inside Hotaru Tomoe's personality.
programme.sub-title: Shadow of Silence: The Pale Glimmer of a Firefly

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Hotaru tries to avoid Chibi-Usa out of fear that her other personality will bring harm. Undaunted, Chibi-Usa invites Hotaru to go on a picnic.
programme.sub-title: Sunny Skies After a Storm: A Friendship Dedicated to Hotaru

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Shun Hayase is a high school athlete who sets a new national record in the men's high jump after overcoming health issues as a child.

programme.title: Sailor Moon

programme.sub-title: Battle Inside the Demonic Space: The Sailor Guardians' Gamble

programme.title: Haywire, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: After a successful mission to free a Chinese hostage, a highly trained operative (Gina Carano) is betrayed and left for dead by someone in her own agency.

programme.title: The Doorman, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A former soldier must save her niece and nephew from armed thieves planning to steal priceless art from a building in New York City.

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A vacation in Spain turns nightmarish when a man's (Henry Cavill) family is kidnapped by agents who are hell-bent on recovering a mysterious briefcase.

programme.title: Transporter 3, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: Mob courier Frank Martin and the subject of his assignment, a cynical Ukrainian woman, are fitted with shackles that will explode if they wander too far from his car.

programme.title: Mile 22, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A CIA operative and a paramilitary team must transport a foreign intelligence asset 22 miles through Southeast Asia. They soon find themselves in a race against time as the city's military, police and street gangs close in to reclaim the asset.

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: The Cimmerian warrior (Jason Momoa) slashes his way across Hyboria on a mission that begins as a personal vendetta but turns into an epic battle against a supernatural evil.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A map written in Latin leads a slain pirate's daughter (Geena Davis) and her partner (Matthew Modine) to gold and into battle with a murderous uncle (Frank Langella).

programme.title: The Three Musketeers, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A young swordsman (Logan Lerman) joins three of France's finest warriors in a quest to foil a plot against the crown.

programme.title: Red 2, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: Former CIA black-ops agent Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) and his team battle assassins, terrorists and power-hungry government officials as they try to retrieve a lethal device that could change the balance of world power.

programme.title: Gladiator, (2000, Blockbusters)
programme.desc: A man robbed of his name and his dignity strives to win them back, and gain the freedom of his people, in this epic historical drama from director Ridley Scott.

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead, (1995, Western)
programme.desc: In this edgy and darkly humorous Western, a mysterious young woman rides into the lawless town of Redemption to settle an old score that has haunted her since she was a child. She becomes swept up in a deadly quick-draw tournament. Rated: R

programme.title: Jerry Maguire, (1996, Drama)

programme.title: Flatliners, (1990, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Are you afraid to die? Kiefer Sutherland isn't. He's an ambitious, charismatic medical student who persuades classmates Julia Roberts and Kevin Bacon to take part in a reckless experiment. Rated: R

programme.title: Zodiac, (2007, Thriller)
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Graysmith books about the real life notorious Zodiac, a serial killer who terrorized San Francisco with a string of seemingly random murders during the 1960s and 1970s.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark, (1981, Action)
programme.desc: Get ready for thrills in Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark. Indy and his ex-flame Marion Ravenwood dodge booby-traps, fight Nazis, and stare down snakes in their incredible worldwide quest for the mystical Ark of the Covenant.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, (1984, Action)
programme.desc: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom brings you thrills and excitement. Indy, his sidekick Short Round and nightclub singer Willie Scott go from high-flying action above the Himalayas to a spine-tingling escape from a fortress-like mine in India.
